intro: Lipochaeta rockii, commonly known as the rock lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lipochaeta rockii is often found in coastal and inland areas where it thrives in full sun and low moisture environments.
